**Text:**

I flick on the lights, and the first thing I see is that damn photo on the mantel. Her smile, so wide and carefree, like she didn't have a worry in the world. My thumb traces her face, like it always does when I'm home alone. I set it back down, but her eyes seem to follow me as I walk away.

My phone beeps. "Happy Anniversary," it says. I'd forgotten about that reminder. Stupid thing to forget, isn't it? What if I'd remembered earlier? Would things have been different?

I sit on the couch, the one we used to share. The springs creak under my weight, like they're complaining about being alone too. I look around the room, at all the empty spaces she used to fill. What if something happens while I'm gone? What if...?

My mind starts racing, imagining scenarios I can't control. What if I fall asleep and don't wake up? Who would find me? What if there's a fire? I don't even have a pet to raise the alarm anymore.

I sigh, running a hand through my hair. These thoughts are stupid, I know. But they're there all the same, like ghosts haunting my mind. I turn off the lights and climb into bed, the sheets cold and unwelcoming. Sleep doesn't come easy when you're always asking "what if?"
